intro: Brachanthemum mongolicum, commonly known as Mongolian thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Brachanthemum mongolicum is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
